content:
Yes, you are correct. The Mumbai-Ahmedabad High-Speed Rail (MAHSR) project is divided into 27 packages or sections, each covering a specific stretch of the corridor. Here is a list of the 27 sections of the project along with their respective lengths:

1. C1: 21 km (Bandra Kurla Complex, Mumbai to Shilphata, Maharashtra)
2. C2: 20 km (Shilphata to Padgha, Maharashtra)
3. C3: 116 km (Padgha to Zaroli Village, Maharashtra-Gujarat Border)
4. C4: 39 km (Zaroli Village to Vadodara, Gujarat)
5. C5: 237 km (Vadodara to Vapi, Gujarat-Maharashtra Border)
6. C6: 8 km (Vapi Station to Karambeli, Maharashtra)
7. C7: 87 km (Karambeli to Surat, Gujarat)
8. C8: 18 km (Surat to Bilimora, Gujarat)
9. C9: 95 km (Bilimora to Vapi, Gujarat)
10. C10: 53 km (Vapi to Boisar, Maharashtra)
11. C11: 64 km (Boisar to Bhiwandi-Kalyan, Maharashtra)
12. C12: 40 km (Bhiwandi-Kalyan to Dahanu, Maharashtra)
13. C13: 22 km (Vadodara Station to Anand, Gujarat)
14. C14: 54 km (Anand to Ahmedabad, Gujarat)
15. C15: 18 km (Ahmedabad Station to Apparel Park, Gujarat)
16. C16: 79 km (Apparel Park to Vataman, Gujarat)
17. C17: 8 km (Vataman to Santalpur, Gujarat)
18. C18: 95 km (Santalpur to Radhanpur, Gujarat)
19. C19: 46 km (Radhanpur to Samakhiali, Gujarat)
20. C20: 20 km (Samakhiali to Hapa, Gujarat)
21. C21: 77 km (Hapa to Rajkot, Gujarat)
22. C22: 49 km (Rajkot to Surendranagar, Gujarat)
23. C23: 112 km (Surendranagar to Ahmedabad, Gujarat)
24. C24: 4 km (BKC Station, Mumbai to Thane, Maharashtra)
25. C25: 21 km (Thane to Virar, Maharashtra)
26. C26: 26 km (Virar to Boisar, Maharashtra)
27. C27: 13 km (Pachpadra to Marwar, Rajasthan)

Please note that the lengths of the packages are approximate and subject to change. The project is being implemented by the National High-Speed Rail Corporation (NHSRCL), which is responsible for the overall coordination, management, and execution of the project.
